Events that occurred on 8 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1904 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Francis Morgan.
1924 - Director Gene Deitch is born.
1925 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to H.F.B. Brett-Smith.
1953 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 139.
1981 - Mythcon 12 at Mills College in Oakland, California.
1986 - Mythcon 17 at California State University in Long Beach.
1994 - Mythcon 25 at American University, Washington, D.C.
1995 - Tyalië Tyelelliéva issue 6 is published.
1995 - Parma Eldalamberon issue 11 is published.
1997 - Mythcon 28 at Pepperdine University in Malibu, California.
2002 - Tolkien Thing IV in Westerwald, Germany.
2005 - Omentielva Minya - 1st International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Stockholm, Sweden.
2007 - Omentielva Tatya - the 2nd International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Antwerp, Belgium.
2009 - Omentielva Nelya - 3rd International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Whitehaven, England.
2013 - Omentielva Lempea - 5th International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Helsinki, Finland.
2014 - Mythcon 45 in Wheaton College, Massachusetts.
2015 - Omentielva Enquea - Sixth International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Greisinger Museum, Switzerland.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
